channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Approx 12 inch pothole which is line with normal travel, 15th April
item.description:
Entering from Cheltenham Road just before the junction to the mini roundabout turning left to Tesco's
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light green phase not long enough, 15th April
item.description:
The sequencing has recently changed leading to huge tailbacks in the a417 coming from c&g roundabout. At all times of the day and totally unacceptable during rush hour. This has been reported numerous times over the last week yet nothing happened. It affects school traffic massively every morning. Sort it out please or provide a reason for the sequence change.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmbridge Court Roundabout, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple sacks of what apears to be soil/gravel have been partially spilling onto the carriageway for several weeks, 15th April
item.description:
These are directly opposite the entrance to Colgate Farm, Ham Hill. They have been there for many weeks despite being reported to the council website.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ham Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham

item.title: Numerous potholes on this road, 15th April
item.description:
Between the Racecourse roundabout and the junction with Marle HIl roundabout there are numerous potholes which due to their depth and frequency, are affecting how people drive in that area. This is a danger to all road users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Swindon Lane, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 15th April
item.description:
Customer reports multiple potholes along the stretch of road. However, they can be found largely around either side of the of the ford. They are around 12" in diameter (depth uknown) and full of water - potentially a danger to motorcycles.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 15th April
item.description:
Customer states that a tree branch has fallen of a tree and has gone through her windscreen. They need looking at as limbs fall of these regularly and need looking at again, they were looked at last year. Customer wants to make a claim.

item.title: Short traffic light sequence suddenly, 15th April
item.description:
A40 onto Elmbridge court roundabout from Barnwood, the traffic lights are only letting through 3/4 vehicles at a time and causing major delays back up to barnwood roundabout all times of the day
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
